results.title: Hiroshima Mon Amour
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, Como Films, Daiei Film, Pathé Overseas, Marguerite Duras, Mayo, Samy Halfon, Gerard Collery, Minoru Esaka, Lucilla Mussini, Petri, Alain Resnais, Anatole Dauman and Pathé Entertainment
results.brief_description: The deep conversation between a Japanese architect and a French actress forms the basis of this celebrated French film, considered one of the vanguard productions of the French New Wave. Set in Hiroshima after the end of World War II, the couple — lovers turned friends — recount, over many hours, previous romances and life experiences. The two intertwine their stories about the past with pondering the devastation wrought by the atomic bomb dropped on the city.

constellations_other.name: All about Agnes
constellations_other.description: Belgian director Agnes Varda was the only female director in the French New Wave movement and is known for her long career across influential documentary and dramas, and for her trademark humour, curiosity and insight.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Argos Films, Como Films, Daiei Film, Pathé Overseas, Marguerite Duras, Mayo, Samy Halfon, Gerard Collery, Minoru Esaka, Lucilla Mussini, Petri, Alain Resnais, Anatole Dauman and Pathé Entertainment

results.title: Hinter Gittern - Der Frauenknast
results.brief_description: Drama set in a women’s prison in Germany. Susanne Teubner, a sympathetic young woman who has killed her husband in an affect, is poorly advised by her lawyer and sentenced to life imprisonment for willful murder. The arrival in prison is a shock to her. Resigned and exhausted, she endures the degrading admission procedure. She doesn’t notice that the young doctor Dr. Beck immediately felt more than professional interest for her.

constellations_other.name: Women and crime
constellations_other.description: The allure and fascination of dangerous women and women in danger.

results.title: High Score
results.brief_description: This docuseries traces the history of classic video games, featuring insights from the innovators who brought these worlds and characters to life.
results.description: This docuseries traces the history of classic video games, featuring insights from the innovators who brought these worlds and characters to life.

results.title: High Fidelity
results.creator_credit: Midnight Radio, ABC Signature, Nick Hornby, Adrienne Erickson and Ray Quinlan
results.brief_description: Rob Brooks, a female record store owner in the rapidly gentrified neighborhood of Crown Heights, Brooklyn revisit past relationships through music and pop culture, while trying to get over her one true love.

constellations_other.name: Film and TV dreams
constellations_other.description: Fleetwood Mac's 'Dreams' coasted its way back up the charts 40 years after it was first released, thanks to Nathan Apodaca's joyous viral TikTok, but Fleetwood Mac (and Stevie Knicks) have been main staples of screen culture for decades.

results.title: Hidden Figures
results.creator_credit: Fox 2000 Pictures, Levantine Films, Chernin Entertainment, Wynn Thomas, Donna Gigliotti, Jenno Topping, Renee Ehrlich Kalfus, Allison Schroeder, Peter Chernin, Pharrell Williams and Theodore Melfi
results.brief_description: The untold story of Katherine G. Johnson, Dorothy Vaughan and Mary Jackson – brilliant African-American women working at NASA and serving as the brains behind one of the greatest operations in history – the launch of astronaut John Glenn into orbit. The visionary trio crossed all gender and race lines to inspire generations to dream big.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fox 2000 Pictures, Levantine Films, Chernin Entertainment, Wynn Thomas, Donna Gigliotti, Jenno Topping, Renee Ehrlich Kalfus, Allison Schroeder, Peter Chernin, Pharrell Williams and Theodore Melfi

results.title: Hey Hey It's Saturday
results.creator_credit: Somers Carroll Productions and United Media
results.brief_description: Hey Hey It’s Saturday was a long-running variety television program on Australian television. It initially ran for 27 years, from 1971 to 1999. Its host throughout its entire run was Daryl Somers.

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

results.description: Hey Hey It’s Saturday was a long-running variety television program on Australian television. It initially ran for 27 years, debuting on the Nine Network on 9 October 1971 and broadcasting its last episode on 20 November 1999. Its host throughout its entire run was Daryl Somers, who would later become executive producer of the program. The original producer, Gavin Disney, left the program in the 1980s and Somers then jointly formed his own production company, Somers Carroll Productions, with on-screen partner Ernie Carroll, the performer of Somers’ puppet sidekick Ossie Ostrich.
description_for_label: Hey Hey It’s Saturday was a long-running variety television program on Australian television. It initially ran for 27 years, debuting on the Nine Network on 9 October 1971 and broadcasting its last episode on 20 November 1999. Its host throughout its entire run was Daryl Somers, who would later become executive producer of the program. The original producer, Gavin Disney, left the program in the 1980s and Somers then jointly formed his own production company, Somers Carroll Productions, with on-screen partner Ernie Carroll, the performer of Somers’ puppet sidekick Ossie Ostrich.

results.title: Hereafter
results.creator_credit: Malpaso Productions, Amblin Entertainment, The Kennedy/Marshall Company, Clint Eastwood, Kathleen Kennedy, James J. Murakami, Robert Lorenz and Peter Morgan
results.brief_description: Three people — a blue-collar American, a French journalist and a London school boy — are touched by death in different ways.

constellations_other.name: Representing disasters
constellations_other.description: The devastating Indian Ocean tsunami was captured by many people on personal devices and home cameras, with the footage broadcast to the world. The event also inspired feature films that are part of a long tradition of disaster films, which often push the boundaries of VFX.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Malpaso Productions, Amblin Entertainment, The Kennedy/Marshall Company, Clint Eastwood, Kathleen Kennedy, James J. Murakami, Robert Lorenz and Peter Morgan

results.title: Heil Honey I'm Home!
results.brief_description: Controversial British television sitcom that was cancelled with only one episode. In Berlin, 1938, Adolf Hitler and Eva Braun have a love-hate relationship with their Jewish neighbours in this bizarre spoof of ‘fifties American sitcoms. Neville Chamberlain is coming to Germany and Adolf has to host. But will his Jewish neighbors wreck his plans to impress?

constellations_other.name: Undercutting extremism with absurdity
constellations_other.description: Taika Waititi's satirical performance as Adolf Hitler in Jojo Rabbit connects to a number of other portrayals that includes ill-fated (and conceived) TV shows, memes, high camp and cinema classics.

results.description: Controversial British television sitcom that was cancelled with only one episode. results.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
results.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
results.brief_description: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

results.title: Hard to Handle: Bob Dylan in Concert
results.creator_credit: HBO, Wolfboy Productions and Gillian Armstrong
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1986
results.brief_description: In this concert filmed at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in 1986, Dylan is accompanied by Tom Petty and the band The Heartbreakers, as well as a very fine selection of new compositions in a concert film shot by Gillian Armstrong.

constellations_other.name: Brilliant careers (Gillian Armstrong)
constellations_other.description: Gillian Armstrong's feature film debut not only helped launch her own acclaimed career, but those of the actors as well.

results.title_for_label: Hard to Handle: Bob Dylan in Concert
results.description: Admired as one of the best lyricists of pop rock, Bob Dylan has his name recorded in music history. During his four decades career, he has been through many facets: from acoustic to electric guitar; from politicized to religious lyrics; from minimalist to very highly sophisticated arrangements. And his characteristic voice, for some, hoarse and full of style, for others a little out of tune, still influences many musicians. In this presentation filmed at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in Australia over February 24-25 1986, Dylan is accompanied by Tom Petty and the band The Heartbreakers, as well as a very fine selection of new compositions. To close the spectacle, Bob Dylan and Tom Petty perform a vocal duet in “Knockin’ on heaven’s door”, one of the most famous songs of this compositor.
